suggestions.title: Random Number Generation and Quality
suggestions.summary: Discusses the importance of generating high‑quality random numbers, the impact of RNG quality on simulation results, and common methods for producing random variates from probability distributions.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Random number generation using probability distributions ... Random number quality affects results

suggestions.title: Sampling Techniques and Replacement Strategies
suggestions.summary: Explores different ways to sample from populations or theoretical distributions, including sampling with and without replacement, and their role in bootstrapping and Monte Carlo methods.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Sampling from populations or theoretical distributions ... Bootstrapping is a resampling technique used to estimate the sampling distribution of a statistic (e.g., mean, median) by drawing samples with replacement from the observed dataset.

suggestions.title: Convergence, Accuracy, and Number of Iterations
suggestions.summary: Analyzes how the number of simulation iterations influences the accuracy of estimates, the concept of convergence in Monte Carlo simulations, and practical guidelines for choosing N or B.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Accuracy depends on number of iterations

suggestions.title: Bootstrap Confidence Intervals
suggestions.summary: Provides a detailed look at constructing confidence intervals using bootstrap resampling, including percentile, bias‑corrected, and accelerated methods.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Use the distribution of means to estimate standard error and confidence intervals.

suggestions.title: Computational Efficiency and Parallelization
suggestions.summary: Covers strategies to reduce computational load, such as vectorized operations, parallel processing, and using optimized libraries for large‑scale simulations.

suggestions.title: Visualization of Simulation Outcomes
suggestions.summary: Describes techniques for visualizing stochastic processes and Monte Carlo results to aid intuition, including histograms, scatter plots, and convergence plots.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Enables visual understanding of stochastic processes

suggestions.title: Domain Applications: Finance and Artificial Intelligence
suggestions.summary: Highlights how statistical simulation is applied in financial risk modeling, option pricing, and AI model evaluation, illustrating the versatility of Monte Carlo and bootstrapping.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Applicable across science, finance, and AI

suggestions.title: Monte Carlo Estimation of Mathematical Constants
suggestions.summary: Uses the classic π estimation example to illustrate Monte Carlo principles, error analysis, and how increasing sample size improves the estimate.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Example: Estimation of π using random points inside a unit square.

suggestions.title: Resampling Strategies Beyond Simple Bootstrapping
suggestions.summary: Introduces advanced resampling methods such as the jackknife, block bootstrap, and permutation tests, extending the basic bootstrapping concept.
suggestions.supporting_quote: Bootstrapping is a resampling technique used to estimate the sampling distribution of a statistic

suggestions.title: Assessing Random Number Generators
suggestions.summary: Provides criteria and tests (e.g., chi‑square, Kolmogorov‑Smirnov) for evaluating the randomness of generated numbers, ensuring reliable simulation outcomes.
